image.altText: Linda Burney smiles and waves as she leaves a press conference. She is next to the Aboriginal and Australian flags.

props.synopsis: The Indigenous Australians minister says she gave everything she could "with all her heart" to advance reconciliation and improve the lives of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

title.children: 'I won't be the last': Indigenous Australians Minister Linda Burney bows out after a trailblazing career

image.altText: Spray bottle of Roundup on hardware store shelf

props.synopsis: There is insufficient evidence to prove the controversial weedkiller Roundup causes cancer, the Federal Court has ruled.

title.children: 'The science is not all one way': Landmark class action against weedkiller Roundup thrown out

image.altText: A shot from behind of a mother and a son sitting on a park bench.

props.synopsis: The Closing the Gap strategy set out to halve the rate of First Nations children in out-of-home care by 2031, but the numbers are still climbing.

title.children: Tahnee has two years to turn things around or her children could be removed

image.altText: Jessica Sergis of the Roosters makes a break during the round four NRLW match between Newcastle Knights and Sydney Roosters at Allianz Stadium, on September 11, 2022, in Sydney, Australia.

props.synopsis: The 2024 NRLW season is about to get underway as two-time defending premiers Newcastle take on the Roosters in a bumper heavyweight clash between two championship contenders. Follow live.

title.children: Knights host Roosters in blockbuster NRLW season opener

image.altText: The abandoned town.

props.synopsis: Pyramiden was abandoned after the fall of the Soviet Union, but plans for its revival are adding to growing tensions with NATO in the Arctic.

title.children: Russian plans for a Soviet time capsule town have its NATO rivals spooked

image.altText: Joe Biden sits at a desk in the Oval Office, wearing blue tie, pointing with one hand

props.synopsis: In an Oval Office address to explain why he abandoned his re-election bid, Joe Biden said he believes he's earned a second term as US president, but "personal ambition" cannot get in the way of saving democracy.

title.children: 'Kings and dictators do not rule': Biden's Oval Office address on why he quit the race for re-election

image.altText: Nine newspapers

props.synopsis: Journalists from multiple major Australian newspapers have announced they will go on strike from Friday morning, on the eve of the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Journalists from The Age, SMH and other Nine Publishing mastheads announce strike on eve of Olympics

image.altText: Alice Milliat sits and looks to one side

props.synopsis: At the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, men and women are represented equally for the first time, thanks in part to a French pioneer who helped force the IOC and World Athletics to recognise female athletes.

title.children: This woman was treated as an irritation for most of her life. It's thanks to her the Paris Olympics have an equal gender split today

image.altText: A baby with chubby cheeks and curly brown hair staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Leaders in Djarindjin hope long-awaited recognition from the WA government will trigger economic and social development.

title.children: 'More than just a piece of paper': Remote community's pride after victory in four-decade fight for recognition

image.altText: Women, children and men gather in a village under a palm tree in Papua New Guinea

props.synopsis: Violent attacks on three remote villages in Papua New Guinea's north has reportedly killed 26 people, including 16 children, while several people were forced to flee after attackers set fire to their homes, the United Nations said.

title.children: People beheaded, a village burned amid brutal violence in PNG province

image.altText: A woman wrapped in a green, red, blue and yellow flag of New Caledonia's independence movement.

props.synopsis: France has sharply rejected accusations that it undermined decolonisation in New Caledonia and says it's still deciding when a high-level Pacific delegation will be permitted to visit the territory.

title.children: 'It doesn't make sense': French ambassador dismisses idea of mediation with New Caledonia pro-independence groups

image.altText: A man in a suit smiling and waving

props.synopsis: The Israeli PM made a forceful, combative and unapologetic speech in the US centre of political power, and while one side of his audience was in raptures, the other seemed less convinced.

title.children: Netanyahu has counted on America for decades, but his address showed support could be fraying

image.altText: A US dollar note is pictured alongside an Australian 10 dollar and 20 dollar bill.

props.synopsis: After climbing to a six-month high earlier this month, the value of the Australian dollar is tumbling as concerns grow about the health of the Chinese economy.

title.children: Australian dollar tumbles on fears of Chinese economic slowdown

image.altText: A police scene cordoned off.

props.synopsis: Two men die at a cattle station in Camballin in WA's Kimberley region, after the helicopters they were piloting collided, police confirm.

title.children: Helicopters collide and crash shortly after take-off on WA cattle station, killing both pilots

image.altText: Elijah Winnington and Kim Woo-min next to each other on the lane ropes at the 2024 world swimming championships in Doha.

props.synopsis: An Australian Olympic swim coach may be disciplined for publicly stating he hopes a star South Korean athlete defeats Sam Short and Elijah Winnington at the Paris Games.

title.children: 'Serious error of judgment': Aussie coach faces sanction for supporting South Korean swimmer

image.altText: Saline 1

props.synopsis: Australian health services and veterinary clinics are conserving their stock of intravenous fluid or using alternative products amid a global shortage of saline solutions.

title.children: 'Critical' shortage of saline solution in Australia but healthcare workers are managing needs

image.altText: Bruce Lehrman leaves the Federal Court of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer tells the Federal Court the former Liberal staffer wants to delay paying the $2 million he owes to Network Ten, pending a possible appeal against the ruling in his failed defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann seeking to delay paying $2 million he owes to Network Ten, Federal Court told

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The two sides of politics in Australia will slug it out over inflation, immigration and energy between now and the election — and both will be closely watching how these issues play out in the US.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton are watching three potent issues bubbling away in the US

image.altText: Smiling toddler holding some blue bars on a piece of play equipment, looking direct to camera.

props.synopsis: The population of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians has surged past the million person mark.

title.children: Number of First Australians tops 1 million in new figures

image.altText: A man looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Dust Diseases Tribunal found four companies failed in their duty of care to a coal miner who worked at sites in New South Wales and Queensland.

title.children: Former miner with 'black lung' disease awarded record $3.2 million in damages

image.altText: A woman sits in a lounge room and stares into the camera.

props.synopsis: ASIC has launched an investigation into cold callers offering superannuation reviews. Those impacted say they felt pressured to switch superannuation providers.

title.children: 'You're not just selling a box of chocolates': Cold callers offering super reviews under investigation

image.altText: Devil's Thumb on Federation Peak

props.synopsis: The co-conqueror of Mount Everest, Sir Edmund Hilary, described it as Australia's "only true mountain". But, with a death just this week bringing home the dangers, climbers know Tasmania's Federation Peak is not for the faint of heart.

title.children: The deadly lure of 'Australia's only true mountain', Federation Peak

image.altText: Man with black hair in white t-shirt and grey hoodie stands on beach with waves crashing on rocks behind him on a sunny day

props.synopsis: A former financial planner who stole $3.3 million from his clients to fund his sports betting addiction writes to the prime minister from his prison cell, urging him to adopt the recommendations made by a parliamentary inquiry into online gambling harm.

title.children: 'This has to stop': From behind bars, a former sports betting addict is urging the PM to tackle gambling addiction

image.altText: A man wearing a blue Australian aviation uniform standing in front of a military plane.

props.synopsis: Aviation drills for Exercise Pitch Black have resumed today after an aircraft crashed in a remote part of the NT during the multinational military exercise on Wednesday.

title.children: Major military exercise resumes in the NT after Italian jet crash

image.altText: A broken warning sign in front of a giant wave.

props.synopsis: Gaemi is the strongest typhoon to hit Taiwan in eight years and is expected to dump more torrential rain in China's Fujian province.

title.children: Typhoon Gaemi sinks freighter near Taiwan as storm barrels toward China

image.altText: Fire burns a tree in the foreground, while the background forest is reduced to silhouette by smoke.

props.synopsis: Wildfire has begun burning buildings in the town of Jasper, threatening a major oil pipeline.

title.children: Canada fires threaten oil pipeline at idyllic tourist town

image.altText: Teenagers at Surfers Paradise at night in 2013.

props.synopsis: A free, voluntary and confidential pill testing service will be available at schoolies celebrations at Surfers Paradise this year, but only if Labor retains government in October.

title.children: Pill testing to be available at Schoolies on the Gold Coast

image.altText: Vehicles line the road to a ferry pick-up spot.

props.synopsis: Police say the cane truck had been attempting to board the Bluff Point ferry near Lawrence when the ferry became dislodged and the truck rolled off the back.

title.children: Man dies after cane truck slips off river ferry in northern NSW

image.altText: A composite photo of Kaylee McKeown Shayna Jack and Mollie O'Callaghan

props.synopsis: Australia's swimming team has been a veritable medal factory in recent Olympic Games and the expectation in Paris is no different. Here are the Aussie swimmers to watch.

title.children: From Titmus to McKeown — these are the Aussie swimmers carrying our golden hopes in Paris

image.altText: An aerial view shows houses and units in the West Bank, with dirt roads leading between

props.synopsis: Seven Israeli settlers involved in violent attacks on Palestinians and illegal settlement activity in the West Bank are hit with financial sanctions and travel bans.

title.children: Australia imposes sanctions on seven Israeli settlers in West Bank

image.altText: Israel's men's football team in a huddle at the Olympics

props.synopsis: The atmosphere outside the stadium was calm before Israel's Olympic opener against Mali. That soon changed when the match got underway as tensions rose in the stands.

title.children: Israel's men's soccer team booed, anthem jeered during Olympic clash amid heavy police presence

image.altText: Sounkamba Sylla prepares to run

props.synopsis: Sounkamba Sylla has been left outraged after a rule from the French Olympic Committee might cause her to miss the opening ceremony because she wears a hijab.

title.children: 'This is not normal': French sprinter in danger of missing Olympic opening ceremony due to her hijab

image.altText: A heater on the floor with two feet warming up next to it. The feet have socks on

props.synopsis: If you're a renter with no heating or air conditioning in your property, you might have asked your landlord to install one, only to be told no. So, what are the rules? And what are landlords obliged to provide? Here's a breakdown.

title.children: Should heating and cooling be mandatory for rental homes? Here are the rules landlords have to follow

image.altText: Two groups of people look on as a mass of steam, water and rock is shot into the air.

props.synopsis: No injuries were reported, but the Biscuit Basin area was closed for visitor safety after the surprise eruption.

title.children: Watch the moment a Yellowstone hot spring shot steam, water and rock at dozens of tourists
